text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.19.16, Examining Process, Liability Determination, Claims.
IRM 4.19.16.1.1(1) - Added explanation of which claims are handled in Examination.

EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This IRM supersedes IRM 4.19.16 dated February 20, 2018.
This IRM is intended for the use of the SB/SE and W&I Campus Examination Operations.

) Purpose: This IRM provides guidance when processing claims received in Examination. (
) Audience: The primary users of this IRM are Campus Examination employees in Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE) and The Wage and Investment (W&I) Business Operating Divisions (BODs). (
) Policy Owner: The Policy owner of this IRM is the SB/SE Director, Examina- tion Field and Campus Policy. (
) Program Owner: The Program owner of this IRM is SB/SE Campus Examina- tion and Field Support. (
) This section provides general instructions for the claims received in Examina- tion. Claims may relate to any item of income, loss, exclusion, deduction, or credit involving a refund of tax. (
) Examination handles claims for refund that challenge the IRS’s liability deter- mination. (
) Refer to IRM
, Policy Statements for the Examining Process, for more information. (

) The Director, Examination - Field and Campus Policy, reports to the Director, Headquarters Examination, and is responsible for the delivery of policy and guidance that impacts the ﬁeld and campus examination process. See IRM
, Field and Campus Policy, for additional information. (

) Campus Exam and Field Support, which is under the Director, Examination Field and Campus Policy, is the group responsible for providing Servicewide policy guidance on compliance processes that relate to campus examination operations and support Field Exam and Specialty Programs in SB/SE and Large Business & International (LB&I). See IRM
, Campus and Field Support, for additional information. (

) The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) describes ten fundamental rights that all taxpayers have when dealing with the IRS. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accord with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see https://www.irs.gov/taxpayer-bill-of-rights (

) The Embedded Quality Review System (EQRS) is an on-line database accessed through the IRS intranet used by Campus Compliance and Return Integrity and Compliance Services (RICS). EQRS is used by managers and National Quality Review System (NQRS) is used by national Quality Reviewers to input a Data Collection Instrument (DCI) into the system, capturing results on case reviews performed. The EQ website contains an electronic Master Attribute Job Aid (MAJA) that contains information speciﬁc to Examination Paper and Phones. EQRS/NQRS report data is available through the EQRS/ NQRS database as well as in the monthly COBR. IRM
, Embedded Quality (EQ) Program for Accounts Management, Campus Compliance, Field Assistance, Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Return Integrity and Compliance
page

The Embedded Quality Review System (EQRS) is an on-line database accessed through the IRS intranet used by Campus Compliance and Return Integrity and Compliance Services (RICS). EQRS is used by managers and National Quality Review System (NQRS) is used by national Quality Reviewers to input a Data Collection Instrument (DCI) into the system, capturing results on case reviews performed. The EQ website contains an electronic Master Attribute Job Aid (MAJA) that contains information speciﬁc to Examination Paper and Phones. EQRS/NQRS report data is available through the EQRS/ NQRS database as well as in the monthly COBR. IRM 21.10.1, Embedded Quality (EQ) Program for Accounts Management, Campus Compliance, Field Assistance, Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Return Integrity and Compliance
Services (RICS), and Electronic Products and Services Support, provides detailed information on the Embedded Quality review system.

(a). The statute is extended for that period if a taxpayer can show they were: a. Physically or mentally impaired AND b. Were unable to handle their ﬁnancial affairs, AND c. If the physical or mental impairment is expected to result in death OR d. Is expected to last more than
months. EXCEPTION: If a spouse or authorized person could act for the individual, then the period for ﬁling a claim is not extended. Claims (
) Classiﬁcation Section, Examination Operation, will classify all claims not imme- diately processed for refund by the Document Perfection or the Accounts Management Operations. See IRM Exhibit
, Examination Criteria (CAT A) - General, for a complete list of all claims meeting Category A criteria. (

) Protective Claims are ﬁled to protect taxpayers from speciﬁc contingencies affect the normal processing of the document or to extend the statute period due to pending court actions. a. If a protective claim cannot be closed due to contingency action, the claim is selected and forwarded to the appropriate area office or Opera- tions Manager, Examination, for suspense. b. See IRM
, Processing Protective Claims, for additional in- formation. (

) Claim issues, previously decided during a prior audit, are reevaluated and accepted or selected based on additional information included with the claim and data included in the administrative ﬁle. (
) Returns selected for reexamination are based on issue(s) involved rather than the tax change. in (

) Claims that are sent to Accounts Management Operation are scanned into Correspondence Imaging System (CIS), located within the Accounts Manage- ment System (AMS). Excluded from being scanned are claims that are too large to scan which are kept as a paper case. (
) Accounts Management Operation ensures that pages

) If the classiﬁer determines that additional schedules are necessary, the case ﬁle will be returned to Accounts Management to secure the necessary schedule(s), via CIS or local routing procedures if it is a paper case. (
) Non-EIC Forms

-X are normally worked at the campus received and routed by Accounts Management to their campus Exam function. However, there may be times that these cases may be classiﬁed by another Exam Campus to balance inventories among the campuses. (

) Take the following action based on the determination reached by Classiﬁcation: a. For paper cases, claims that are “Accepted” are stamped so that the action and identifying mark of the classiﬁer is readily visible. For CIS cases, select the “Accepted” radio button and include remarks if needed. b. For paper cases, notify Accounts Management of claims that are “Selected” and retained in Examination. For CIS cases, select the “Selected” radio button and include remarks if needed. c. For paper cases, claims that are “Disallowed”, “No Consider” or “Not CAT A”, need to be returned to Accounts Management with an explanation of the law provided. For CIS cases, select the appropriate radio button and include remarks if needed. d. For paper cases, return claims that require additional information to Accounts Management using the Case Note Section. For CIS cases, select the appropriate radio button and include remarks if needed. (
) Operations Assistance Request (OAR) cases will be routed to Exam with OARs as the primary suspense reason on CIS. Refer to IRM
), CIS General Guidelines. (
) The order for classifying all CAT A claims is by IRS received date.

) The order for classifying all CAT A claims is by IRS received date. Note: TAS and Restricted Interest Carryback Claim/Tentative Carryback Refund (RINT/TENT) cases will be worked as ﬁrst priority. (

) Category A Criteria allows for referrals for “Issues speciﬁed by the Director, Examination Field & Campus Policy and the Director, Refundable Credits Program Management”. All of these issues must be coordinated with and approved by Headquarters. Investigations Referral Non – EITC (
) Claim referrals (
-X) from Criminal Investigation (CI) received in Corre- spondence Examination are part of a Preparer Scheme and contain similar issues as Return Preparer Program (RPP) referrals. (
) Generally, the client
-X consists of Schedule A issues, but may contain other issues, such as Education Credit, Child Tax Credit etc. Referrals may contain both preparer signed and unsigned returns. (

) Inventory Delivery and AIMS opening: a. This program includes claims where refunds were stopped (unpaid) released (paid). However, for claims where refunds have been paid (released), returns will be accepted only if there is sufficient time remaining on the statute. b. The Fraud Detection Center (FDC) will ship paper returns or copies returns to the appropriate W&I campus as directed by Exam Headquar- ters (HQ). Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
W

This program includes claims where refunds were stopped (unpaid) and released (paid). However, for claims where refunds have been paid (released), returns will be accepted only if there is sufficient time remaining on the statute. The Fraud Detection Center (FDC) will ship paper returns or copies of returns to the appropriate W&I campus as directed by Exam Headquar
ters (HQ).
c. Cases that are opened manually by the campus must be established AIMS within
business days of receipt of referrals, with the appropriate Project Code and Source Code. Note: Accounts with Z freezes require a Push Code
d. Any rejected inventory should be coordinated through the appropriate Exam analysts. (
) Procedures for working the inventory: a. Multiple year returns should be worked together, when possible. b. See IRM
, Discretionary Programs, for working Schedule A issues and credits. c. For the initial contact, issue Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, with Form
, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim Disallowance, and Form

, Acceptance of Proposed Disallowance of Claim for Refund or Credit. d. If no reply is received to the initial contact or it is determined the claim should be partially or fully disallowed, send the appropriate Letter
-C, Claim Disallowed, (full disallowance) or Letter

-C , Claim Partially allowed, (partial disallowance) with the appropriate paragraphs that advise the taxpayer of his/her appeal rights in the letter. e. The scheme issues found on the return and the reason for disallowance should be notated on the RGS work papers or history sheet. f. Follow deﬁciency procedures to recover refunds which have been released for
-X schemes. Refer to IRM
, Erroneous Refunds.

days of receipt in correspondence unit. (
) To determine how to progress with the audit, do the necessary IDRS research to ensure that the amended return has not been previously processed. (
) The case will be established on AIMS when selected. If the case must be transferred, AIMS full display must be present before CC AMSOC is input. The RGS record will be created.
To determine how to progress with the audit, do the necessary IDRS research to ensure that the amended return has not been previously processed.

Use the following disposal codes when processing claims:
Disposal Code Explanation 1 Claims disallowed in full (agreed or not agreed) 3 Claims allowed in full 4 Agreed claims partially allowed 8 Unagreed claims partially allowed
• Disposal Code Explanation 4 Agreed claims partially allowed (before issuance of Statutory notice) 9 Agreed (after issuance of Statutory notice) 10 Unagreed (after issuance of Statutory notice)
) Use Letter
-D, Initial Contact - Request Additional Information, as the initial contact for the taxpayer. (
) Suspend case for
days waiting for taxpayer response. Do not create an issue until a response is received from the taxpayer. (
) If there is no response in
days, or if the response does not completely support the claim, issue Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, as outlined below. (
) Take appropriate action (i.e. full allowance, partial allowance, or full disallow- ance) on all responses received from the taxpayer. Refer to IRM
, Claims Contact Responses, for additional guidance. (
) Document all work papers (RGS/Paper) with the speciﬁc documentation being requested. (
) Use Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, to propose a claim disallow- ance (including partial disallowance) to the taxpayer. Send two copies of Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, to the taxpayer with a detailed explana- tion of the disallowance. Also send one copy of: • Form
, Acceptance of Proposed Disallowance of Claim for Refund or Credit, and • Form
, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim Disallowance, and • Publication
-A. Note: If the claim will be allowed in part, issue Form
, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, to explain the amounts disallowed. (
) If it is determined that in addition to the claim, amounts from the original return are to be questioned, send Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, as outlined in item
above. Indicate that the claim is being disallowed and an ditional liability is being proposed. Prepare Form
, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, to explain the amounts allowed and not allowed. (
) For claims being allowed in full (and no deﬁciency will be assessed) based upon the taxpayer response to Letter
-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, or Letter
-D, Initial Contact - Request Additional Information, take the following
Note: If the claim will be allowed in part, issue Form 4549, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, to explain the amounts disallowed.

For claims being allowed in full (and no deﬁciency will be assessed) based upon the taxpayer response to Letter 569-B, Letter of Claim Disallowance, or Letter 566-D, Initial Contact - Request Additional Information, take the following
(2) For claims being partially or fully disallowed based upon the information provided from the taxpayer, take the following actions:
Accounts with NO additional tax due:

If And Then The claim is to be disallowed in full The taxpayer does or does not respond 1. If response does not include signed Form 2297, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁca- tion of Claim Disallowance, send Letter 105-C, Claim Disallowed, clearly explain- ing why the claim is being disallowed. 2. If response includes signed Form 2297, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim Disallowance, enter the received date on Form 5344, Examination Closing Record, box 20, Claim Rejection Date. Do not send Letter 105-C, Claim Disal- lowed. 3. Close Case DC 01.
Accounts with additional tax due:

If And Then The claim is to be partially or fully disallowed The taxpayer responds with signed Form 3363, Acceptance of Proposed Disallowance of Claim for Refund or Credit or Form 4549, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, before issuance of Statutory Notice 1. Prepare Form 4549, Report of Income Tax Examination Changes, to explain the amounts allowed and not allowed. 2. If response does not include signed Form 2297, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁca- tion of Claim Disallowance, send Letter 105-C, Claim Disallowed or Letter 106-C, Claim Partially Disallowed, clearly explaining why the claim is being partially or fully disallowed 3. If response includes signed Form 2297, Waiver of Statutory Notiﬁcation of Claim Disallowance, enter the received date on Form 5344, Examination Closing Record, box 20, Claim Rejection Date. Do not send Letter 105-C, Claim Disal- lowed, or 106-C, Claim Partially Disallowed. 4. Close case DC 04. 4.19.16.2.4.3(11-01-2021) Classiﬁcation of Amended or (1) Accounts Management will not assess amended returns with tax increase or credit decrease, except for certain Substitute for Return (SFR) accounts prior to being forwarded to Examination for association with the original return. Refer to IRM 21.5.3-1, Claim Processing with Examination Involvement, for 4.19 Liability Determination

) Accounts Management will not assess amended returns with tax increase credit decrease, except for certain Substitute for Return (SFR) accounts to being forwarded to Examination for association with the original return. Refer to IRM
, Claim Processing with Examination Involvement, for more information. (
) If an amended estate tax return is received see IRM
, Campus Estate and Gift. (

) If the original return is in Centralized Files and Scheduling (CF&S), awaiting examination, the original return should be requested from CF&S, associated with the amended return, and sent to a classiﬁer for review. Do not leave in CF&S.
Note: If the original return is awaiting classiﬁcation, the assessed amended return is associated with the original return and becomes a part of the case ﬁle.

If there is an indication that the taxpayer has already been contacted about the examination (AIMS status 10 and above), the examiner assigned to the exami- nation must be contacted before making any assessment.

IF AND THEN The original return is in Centralized Files & Classiﬁcation Awaiting Classiﬁca- tion 1. Associate the assessed claim with the original return. 2. Both returns will be reviewed by the classiﬁer and appropriateactiontaken. The original return is in Centralized Files & Classiﬁcation Selected for Exami- nation 1. Secure the original return from CF&S. 2. The case ﬁle and amended return are reviewed by Campus Classiﬁ- cation. The original return is in Correspondence Examination Status 10 or above 1. Associate the amended return with the case ﬁle. 2. Forward the amended return to the assigned workgroup to be associated with the case ﬁle and reviewed. The original return is open in the Area Office Any Status Forward the amended return to the group based upon the: • BOD code, • PBC, • SBC and • EGC.

Claims (
) This section outlines the procedures for handling speciﬁc specialized claims issues. Note: Section
of the TCJA amended §
to temporarily suspend all miscel- laneous itemized deductions. For any taxable year beginning after December
and ending before January
, an individual taxpayer is not permitted to claim miscellaneous itemized deductions. Claims (

) Claims have been received from Maritime Personnel related to: • Expenses associated with traveling to and from union halls to seek ployment (job search). • Refund claims for deduction of Meal and Incidental Expense (M&IE). Diem Expenses (

) Merchant mariners who ﬁle claims for incidental expenses while temporarily traveling away from home, (meals and lodging furnished by their employers) will be allowed at the daily amount equal to the “Incidental Expense” portion the Federal M&IE per diem rates in the Federal Travel Regulations. (
) Rates for localities in the Continental United States (CONUS) are $

per day. Rates for localities outside the Continental United States (OCONUS) and foreign localities are published in the Per Diem Supplement to the Standardized Regulations (Government Civilians, Foreign Areas) are updated on a monthly basis and are available at, https://www.defensetravel.dod.mil/site/ perdiem.cfm . These areas include: • Alaska, • Hawaii, • Puerto Rico and • The possessions of the United States. (
) Customer Account Services (CAS) will disallow claims without a breakdown how the deduction was computed (days & rate). They will: a. Send a Letter
-C, Claim Disallowed, requesting the breakdown and advise the taxpayer of the $

per day incidental reimbursement provided for in the Revenue Rulings. b. Send any perfected claim or any claim for expenses associated with traveling to and from union halls to seek employment to Exam as CAT (

) Exam correspondence will work the CAT A referrals using the following guide- lines: • Claims received for incidental expenses using the CONUS rate of a day (when in route), and • The OCONUS rate (if docked in a foreign or non-foreign port, see web site in (
) above) will be allowed. Note: Only address the “foreign” rate if taxpayer initiates and has a copy of the ship’s log or a contemporaneous record of the ship’s movement. (
) The claims may cite the following:

These areas include: • Alaska, • Hawaii, • Puerto Rico and • The possessions of the United States. (

-C, Claim Disallowed, requesting the breakdown and advise the taxpayer of the $

per day incidental reimbursement provided for in the Revenue Rulings. b. Send any perfected claim or any claim for expenses associated with traveling to and from union halls to seek employment to Exam as CAT (

a day (when in route), and • The OCONUS rate (if docked in a foreign or non-foreign port, see web site in (
) above) will be allowed. Note: Only address the “foreign” rate if taxpayer initiates and has a copy of the ship’s log or a contemporaneous record of the ship’s movement. (
) The claims may cite the following:
Customer Account Services (CAS) will disallow claims without a breakdown of how the deduction was computed (days & rate). They will:
Note: Travel to the local union hall is not deductible.

) In working claims where the taxpayer claims meals and lodging expenses for travel to a union hall, a number of issues must be addressed: a. Were the expenses incurred while the taxpayer was searching for new employment in the same trade or business? b. The reasonableness of the need to obtain rest or sleep while traveling the union hall. c. The taxpayer’s home or regular place of business. d. Were the trips to the union hall business or personal? (
) These claims are of fact-intensive character and will need to be worked following sequential tests. (
) For CONUS claims that seek reimbursement of the full Federal Per Diem Rate (M&IE), and include a breakdown of the days and rate of reimbursement: a. Allow only $
per day for incidental expenses. b. Send Letter

-C, Claim Partially Disallowed, to disallow the inappropri- ate portion of the claim. Include the following wording in an open paragraph:“Claimsfor reimbursement of incidental expenses incurred by mariners temporarily away from home (when meals and lodging have been furnished by the employer), are limited to the Federal Per Diem Rate of $
per day as speciﬁed in the Federal Travel Regulations for CONUS (Continental United States) travel. Expenses in excess of the incidental per diem rate must be supported by documentation.” (

) For OCONUS claims that seek reimbursement of the full Federal Per Diem Rate (M&IE) and include a breakdown of the days and rate of reimbursement, the taxpayer must: a. Present a copy of the ship’s log, or b. A reasonably contemporaneous record of ship’s movement. (

) After verifying that the OCONUS rate is correct, allow the applicable OCONUS incidental rate in effect for that locality. Note: If the foreign locality is any other locality than those listed, we will use the rate of $
per day for incidentals. (
) Send Letter

-C, Claim Disallowed, if taxpayer has not provided the above mentioned documentation. Include the following wording in an open paragraph: “Claims for reimbursement of incidental expenses incurred by mariners tempo- Internal Revenue Manual

a. Were the expenses incurred while the taxpayer was searching for new employment in the same trade or business? b. The reasonableness of the need to obtain rest or sleep while traveling the union hall. c. The taxpayer’s home or regular place of business. d. Were the trips to the union hall business or personal?
For CONUS claims that seek reimbursement of the full Federal Per Diem Rate (M&IE), and include a breakdown of the days and rate of reimbursement:
Allow only $
per day for incidental expenses. Send Letter

-C, Claim Partially Disallowed, to disallow the inappropri- ate portion of the claim. Include the following wording in an open paragraph:“Claimsfor reimbursement of incidental expenses incurred by mariners temporarily away from home (when meals and lodging have been furnished by the employer), are limited to the Federal Per Diem Rate of $
per day as speciﬁed in the Federal Travel Regulations for CONUS (Continental United States) travel. Expenses in excess of the incidental per diem rate must be supported by documentation.”

) For OCONUS claims that seek reimbursement of the full Federal Per Diem Rate (M&IE) and include a breakdown of the days and rate of reimbursement, the taxpayer must: a. Present a copy of the ship’s log, or b. A reasonably contemporaneous record of ship’s movement. (
) After verifying that the OCONUS rate is correct, allow the applicable OCONUS incidental rate in effect for that locality.

Send Letter 105-C, Claim Disallowed, if taxpayer has not provided the above mentioned documentation. Include the following wording in an open paragraph: “Claims for reimbursement of incidental expenses incurred by mariners tempo-

rarily away from home (when meals and lodging have been furnished by employer), for OCONUS travel must include a copy of the ship’s log or ably contemporaneous record of ship’s movement, and a breakdown of the days and applicable rate in effect for that locality. Reimbursement is limited the rate set by the Department of the State for incidental expenses only.” (
) If the taxpayer has requested full reimbursement of M&IE and provided mentation, send Letter

-C, Claim Partially Disallowed, to disallow the inappropriate portion of the claim. Include in your letter the following: a. Explain in an open paragraph that reimbursement is limited to the set by the Department of the State. b. Reference the allowable rate in effect for the localities that the taxpayer has indicated on his claim. Expense Claims (

) Claims received for actual incidental expenses exceeding the daily per rate, must be accompanied by adequate documentary evidence. This docu- mentation can include: • account books, • daily diary, • ship’s log, • statement of expense, • trip sheet or • similar record. (
) Claims received without documentary evidence will be disallowed in full. a. Send Letter

-C, Claim Disallowed. b. Use the following wording in an open paragraph: “Claims for actual reimbursement of incidental expenses incurred by mariners temporarily away from home are subject to the full substantia- tion requirements of Treasury Regulation
This may be an account book, diary, ship’s log, statement of expense, trip sheet or similar documentation.” Disability for Separated due Medical/Disability (

) Veterans who are separated from military service due to medical or disability reasons generally receive a severance pay. These veterans are not military retired. Once the veteran receives a determination letter from the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) awarding a retroactive disability rating, the disability severance payment (DSP) received upon discharge becomes non-taxable. Generally, the disability pay is based on a percentage that relates to the degree of impairment. (
) Refer to IRM
, The Combat-Injured Veterans Tax Fairness Act
- Veteran’s Disability Compensation for Veterans Separated due to Medical/Disability, for more guidance on these claims. of Carryback Returns (

) Allowances with related returns (carryback or carry over years) currently in the Area Office will be forwarded to the Area Office. The tentative allowance cases will be classiﬁed with the loss year return only if the tentative allowance is based on net operating loss or a capital loss carryback.

The tentative allowance cases will be classiﬁed with the loss year return only if the tentative allowance is based on net operating loss or a capital loss carryback.

Allowances with related returns (carryback or carry over years) currently open in the Area Office will be forwarded to the Area Office. The tentative allowance cases will be classiﬁed with the loss year return only if the tentative allowance is based on net operating loss or a capital loss carryback.
Tentative allowance cases will be classiﬁed with the year of the unused invest- ment credit only if the tentative allowance is based on investment credit
A copy of the refund application and a copy of the loss year return should be sent to Examination Classiﬁcation within

work days of receipt and before making the refund allowance. The refund application, the loss year return, and any additional returns necessary should be classiﬁed. The concerned Area Office may be contacted to determine the appli- cable classiﬁcation Area Office. Loss applications selected for examination are forwarded immediately to the appropriate Area Office in a folder marked, “Bankruptcy-Tentative Carryback Case”. All Examination action must be completed and notiﬁcation given to the Accounts Management Branch at the Campus within
days from the date the application was received by the IRS.
